page.title: 01AREA SOUTH OF BARRHEAD
page.content:
The area lies to the{south of Barrhead and is enclosed by{Neilston}on the West and by{Newton Mearns}on the East.
The main industry is{farming}and the area consists almost entirely of farmland (18 farms) interspersed with woodland, dams and reservoirs. { {Transport}is non-existent and most roads are single lane.
The principal physical feature is the extinct volcano{DUNCARNOCK} (known locally as the{Craigie}) which is the site of an Iron Age fort.
The reservoirs provide{fishing occasional{curling}and a focus for {walking}and those interested in {wildlife}.There is also a regularly used venue for{motorcycle scrambling}.
